page.title: 13ELLISTONE FARM - STAINLAND
page.content: Ellistone Farm keep two types of beef cattle. These are Herefords and Charolais. The beef cattle are kept separate from the dairy cattle and are kept just long enough to fatten them up, then they are sold at local cattle markets. During the summer the farmer is very busy making silage. He uses one machine to cut the grass, and another to scoop up all the grass cuttings and blow them into a trailer. The trailer is then driven to another part of the farm where the grass is unloaded. The farmer then covers the grass with polythene so that air can not get in. In winter, when the cows can't find any grass, they eat this. To stop the cows from trampling over all the silage the farmer uses an electric fence. This doesn't hurt the cows, it just makes them tingle.
